medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe nasal airway problems due to previous septal surgery.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 38-year-old man with a history of Behçet disease, presented with nasal airway issues stemming from a septal operation performed in 1983. He underwent surgery after a remission period following treatment for Behçet disease.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of Behçet disease, characterized by oral and genital ulcerations, aphthous lesions, arthritis, and other systemic symptoms. He had been receiving colchicine and steroids as treatment since 1992.
medical_history.family_history: The patient’s two sisters have also been treated for Behçet disease.
